page.title: 21Abberley Post Office
page.content:
The Village Post Office has now been sold as a private house and the Post Office counter is now in the Village Shop, previously known as Flello's. The area behind this shop, which used to provide a route in from the main road and from the common, as well as a car park for the shop, has also been sold for housing development.

The other shop which was in the middle of the village, next to the Manor Arms, has also been sold and reconverted to a private house.

The Village School is flourishing and has a number of modern extensions.

The Village Hall, which used to be next to the school, was demolished and the site developed for housing. A new village hall was built opposite the school and is used by the Playgroup (originally set up in 1983 - 4 in the old village hall) and numerous other village groups as well as providing a venue for parties and weddings.
